    • com.quinsoft.zeidon.dbhandler.AbstractSqlHandler

extends Object
implements DbHandler, GenKeyHandler

    DG

        protected EnumSet<ActivateFlags> activateFlags

      • options

        protected AbstractOptionsConfiguration options

      • activateOptions

        protected ActivateOptions activateOptions
        When activating, this is a cast of options as ActivateOptions. I.e. activateOptions = (ActivateOptions) options.

      • joinableChildren

        protected Map<EntityDef,List<EntityDef>> joinableChildren
        Keeps a list of entities that are joinable for this activate.

      • loadedInstances

        protected Map<EntityDef,Map<Object,EntityInstance>> loadedInstances
        This is the list of instances that have been loaded. It is limited to instances that have children that can be loaded in one SELECT. The sub-map is keyed by the key value of the entity instance.

      • loadedViewEntities

        protected Set<EntityDef> loadedViewEntities
        This hash set keeps track of view entities that have been loaded. It's used to determine if we've already loaded the instances of a EntityDef.

        public void setDbGenerateKeys(boolean set)
        Description copied from interface: DbHandler
        If 'set' is true then the DB will autogenerate the genkeys.
        Specified by:

      • useDbGenerateKeys

        protected boolean useDbGenerateKeys()

      • addGeneratedKeyForInsert

        protected boolean addGeneratedKeyForInsert()
        Indicates whether we should add the generated key as part of the insert. By default the value is 'false' if we're using generated keys because the DB will infer it. This means the genkey will not appear at all in the INSERT statements. However some DBs (e.g. SQLite) require us to insert a NULL value for the key. Sqlite will then generate its own key.
        Returns:

      • getTask

        protected Task getTask()

      • writeGenkeyLockRow

        protected void writeGenkeyLockRow(View kzgkhwob,
                      List<? extends View> viewList)
        Write a row with a specific key to the genkey table. A successful write means we have locked the table for this commit.

      • acquireGenkeyLock

        protected void acquireGenkeyLock(View kzgkhwob,
                     List<? extends View> viewList)
        Acquire the genkey lock. It is expected that this method will be overridden by other dbhandlers.
        Parameters:
        kzgkhwob -
        viewList -
